Replies.Reply: I don't know how he found it, T.J.
I locked it in my glove compartment.
Yeah, I see that now, but the trucks were coming before the bank opened.
Duh? No, I guess he just sniffed it out.
He hasn't bought a scratch card in almost thirty two months. I thought it would be okay!
With more than four thousand dollars, he's probably in Atlantic City by now.
I just can't do it anymore.
T.J., we can't make him stop.
It's not stealing if you take it from your family. Anyway, he made some of it, too.
We have it, it's just that they called Troy from Titus last night. That's where Troy works. The ski place? And anyway-
It was some emergency with the lifts. So he took off without thinking with the money. Completely forgot you were coming.
As soon as he can get here, I'll just run it down to you.
Look, Mr. Versales, I have a good job at ALL FOR A DOLLAR. They're probably gonna make me a manager after Christmas so I can handle the payments if you just leave the house-
Listen to me. We'll get them back.
Ricky, I'll get them back. I promise, honey.
You better hurry or you're going to miss the bus. Let's get your clothes on, Ricky.
No! I'm going to work and you're going to school.
The only thing that changed is that your dad started gambling again. Everything else is the same.
He had to take a business trip.
And miss a day of work? No. Not again.
I told you, he could be in Atlantic City by now.
Matt. Could I talk to you?
I need to come on full-time.
When I started you said it would be six months before I could come on full-time.
Well, I mean, you know, I do show up.
Just three...uh, no...two seventy one, two, three, four.
Did you see a Blue Acclaim come in here last night?
Thank you. Oh God, thank you, thank you thank you...
I just need to look inside.
I don't want to play, I just need to look around for a second.
I'll stand right here at the door. I won't even go inside. I just need to see if my husband's in there.
He's gambling away the money for our house.
Long brown hair. Tall. Skinny. Ponytail.
What are you doing with my car?
We'll just see what the troopers say about that.
You can cut the bullshit and give me my keys now.
If you're in there you better come out.
I'm not kidding, honey, come on out.
This is New York State so quit the bullshit and give me my damn keys!
Then you should quit stealing cars.
Did you see where the bus was headed?
Does he use them to rob banks or something?
If you try anything, I'm not afraid to use this.
Wait, who the fuck are they?
I'm not moving until those people get out of my trunk.
I'm not taking them over the border.
What if the troopers stop us.
I told you not to use that thing when I'm not here.
I don't care. Don't use that thing when I'm not here!
At the bus stop on the Rez.
And then what? Chase him across the country. Miss work. No.
Some Indian chick tried to steal your Dad's car.
I didn't have a tow rope.
Forget it T.J. Did you and Ricky eat?
They're gonna flatten it out and send it to China.
They're gonna melt it down and make little toys out if it.
They'll send them back here so I can sell them at All for a Dollar.
We just have to make it to my paycheck on Friday.
You're fifteen, it's not gonna happen so forget it.
Your job is looking after your brother.
Then I wanna get some more of those Chinese.
I just need enough for the balloon payment on my doublewide then I'm out of this. I'm no criminal.
You people can call it what you want to.
What the hell is he doing?
What the hell is going on here?
Why would they want to run?
To get here? No fuckin' way.
Then why don't you count it?
Who wants to go the Price Chopper and get some Cap'n Crunch?
Wanna to go to the Price Chopper?
Matt made me an assistant manager.
Is that so hard to believe?
Exactly, and that's why he gave me a bonus.
Do you wanna go to the Price Chopper or not?
I got something even better than that.
The double wide. But don't mention it to Ricky, just in case.
Yes it is. We're getting a tub, T.J. It's gonna happen.
If you keep that attitude I'll never let you use it.
Why, did he call broke yet?
Oh, here we go again with Saint Dad.
You gotta help Ricky get the tree up tomorrow after school okay?
Hi....it's me...leave a message and I'll call ya' back.
Hi, it's me. I can't take the call right now, but if it's you, Troy, please at least tell me you are alive, because the boys are worried about you.
I can try to put it though again.
I gotta get back before KMART closes.
I got nothing for under the tree.
Don't you people even take Christmas Eve off?
You could fool me the way they were all lined up at All for a Dollar today.
That's awful not to have Santa Claus--
Look, I'm not driving just anybody across the border.
I wanna know what's in the bag.
Well, if they want to come over here so bad, they ought'a take the time to learn English.
I just hope these aren't the ones that blow up themselves and everybody with them.
Nuclear power, poison gas,...you can't tell what they might have in there. I'm not gonna be responsible for that.
-I have to work. Is Ricky asleep?
-No. Not yet. He's still flyin' over Canada okay? He's not even done with Canada yet, so he's not coming until you get to sleep. Now put your brother on.
You'd think a new house would be enough.
It was too heavy. We had to unload it.
It didn't feel like there was anything in that bag.
I can't believe they put their baby in a duffle bag.
If you'd let me search it I would never have taken it-
Tap the bottom of his feet.
That's what they did to get Ricky breathing when he was born.
Well, I can't hold it and drive.
At least put him next to your body. That will warm him up.
Just do it! We can't give it back to her cold.
Oh shit. What do I do?
What if he saw us go by before. To Bob's.
What if he searches the car. What do we say about-
She looks after my kids when I have to work late.
Just a blown out tail light.
Okay, whatever, you brought him back to life.
All I know is Kmart is closed and I got nothing for under the tree.
Look, I don't have time for that. I can't get deep about every little thing. I just have to keep on going. I only need one more run to have enough for my double.
Mitch? Is that the friend you called?
Well, I don't want you hanging around him. That kid is bad news.
Look , Mister, I got more important things to worry about than toys. I'm trying to get our doublewide.
Hey, you can lose the attitude. Anyway, Kmart was closed by the time I got off work.
I told you to be careful with the microwave, didn't I?
I haven't gotten the light fixed-
Not too long. She looks after my kids.
Yeah, I've heard about it but I didn't know she was involved.
Uh, I think there was a sign for a baby sitter at the Wolf Mart. That's where I get my gas.
T.J. could you come out here for a minute.
Did you have a fire last night?
Did you happen to use the blow torch?
Look at this. We can't live here anymore!
Jesus, you could have killed yourself and your brother.
He spent the food money on scratch cards, T.J.
I didn't know how else to keep us together. I mean...he's a good dad when he's not gamblin'.
That's okay. I still wanna buy a ticket.
I just want to buy some scratch cards.
T.J. set the trailer on fire.
He didn't mean to, but the pipes froze and he got that damn torch out -- which I told him not to do touch when I wasn't there -- and he tried to thaw them out-
There's a hole in my bedroom floor. We gotta move.
I just need one more run to get the double.
Look you can have the Acclaim. Okay?
it wasn't all my fault, ya' know. I mean who puts their kid in a duffle bag?
You're gonna need a lot of money to take care of a one year old baby.
Yeah, but you gotta get him first.
I'll help you. You can even borrow my gun.
Three. And it's got a jacuzzi tub in the master bathroom.
Oh yeah. But the best thing is the insulation. The pipes can never freeze.
It's three thousand but I want it delivered tomorrow.
Take it as a deposit. All you have to do is show up. If I don't have the rest you keep it.
No, Troy didn't like to travel. He liked to work in his shed, mostly.
I'm tired of people stealing from me.    Is it all there?
Just COUNT IT and make sure it's all there!
How much farther to the reservation?
What the hell? We're on the reservation.
I thought this was all legal on the reservation.
Listen, my kids got no one but me.
At least you got family to take care of him, ya' know?
It's just a few months, right?
I got baby stuff in the shed.
Get a good used single wide with insulation. Insulation is the key thing.
don't want him to get scared, you know.
And don't let him jerk you around.
How long is it for me. You know if I confess?
But I need to call my kid.
a message and I'll get back to you just as soon as I can.
He drags a suitcase full of plastic dinosaurs around the corner.
Mommy, I was thinking. What's gonna happen to the tin crapper when we get our new house?
And you can buy me some?
Daddy is gettin' me that for Christmas.
Why is the police man here?
We'll need the balloon payment to unload.
This is the second time you've dragged me out here. If you don't come up with it by Christmas, you've lost your fifteen hundred dollar deposit.
Call me when you have the balloon payment.
...what I think you'll find with the Commodore -- and you'll be the judge --
I told you all or nothing.
Can't argue with that. You'll have to sign something, though.
I see you as a short timer.
A short timer. Not here for long, not really committed.
Blue Acclaim...no, but I only worked until 9 PM. You can ask inside.
Did you want to support our Mosquito Lacrosse League. It teaches basic Lacrosse skills to the kids three to five.
Thanks, anyway. Have a good day.
I told you, lady, he's not in there.
The game's over. They're verifying the last winner.
Ray walks away. The ticket taker watches her.
Go ahead, they got no jurisdiction here.
The Tribal police don't like people shooting holes in other people's houses.
This camper belongs to my brother in law.
I thought it was abandoned, the guy driving it got on a bus.
New York or Buffalo, I'm not sure.
I got a friend who might buy that.
He'll pay more than it's worth.
He's always looking for cars with button-
He don't need papers or anything.
All I know is he pays good for a car like this.
He'll give me something for finding it.
Don't worry they already put out the Christmas trees. There's no black ice.
No, it's Mohawk land. The Rez is on both sides of the river.
Don't worry, it'll hold a Plymouth. I've seen semis cross it.
Suddenly, A TRUCK driven by a MOHAWK TEENAGER ROARS out of the woods and SWERVES around the Acclaim FISHTAILING then SPEEDING out across the ice.
Not too fast, there are ruts.
You gotta pick up some speed to get up the bank.
It's just on the other side of those trees.
I'll give you half. Now let's go.
There's no border here. This is free trade between nations.
Maybe he wanted a younger women.
I never have to worry about that. My husband is dead. Went down in the river on a run. They never found him. Probably tangled in river weeds.
You better slow down there are ruts out here. You could get stuck in one.
They won't stop you. You're white.
Pull around back then wait for him to come to the window.
Does Bernie Littlewolf run your whole life?
I gotta walk down 37 with the semis kickin' up snow and mud in my hair just to get to the work.
I'll give you a thousand for the Malibu.
That thing has been sittin' here for six months.
I'll give you the money if you give me the car.
It's gonna cost me to get that hole fixed. I froze last night.
I don't usually work with whites.
I got a boy. Almost one.
Yeah. Right out of the hospital.
Tribal police don't get involved in stuff like that.
An old casino through the woods. They used to have gambling there in the bootlegger days.
Roll down the window and see what he wants.
To get away from the snakeheads.
The snakeheads pay to get them here and then they gotta work off what they owe .
Forty, fifty thousand. Depends where they're coming from.
Sometimes they gotta work for years to pay it off.
Yeah, but they can't stop you unless you give them a reason.
They gave me the choice of paying a fine or spending three months in jail.
I paid the fine. I made the money back in two nights of smuggling. But back then it was cigarettes and everybody did it. Some of the troopers were into it, too.
Yeah. But when they lowered the tax on cigarettes in Canada most people got out of it and the rest switched over to Chinese.
Well, be sure it's right. I don't wanna get stiffed.
Well, she should have. I can't see to count the money. I told you that. I come up short half the time.
To get to work. So I don't have to walk in the breakdown lane. Last week I almost got hit by the plow.
All right, all right! I'll go.
I told Bernie I couldn't see.
I don't know. What difference does it make?
If we wait much longer we won't be able to get back across the river.
Do you want the money or not?
If we keeps snowing like this we won't be able to get across the river.
Is that a two or a five?
You gotta stop so I can fill up the wiper fluid.
It's a hundred feet deep out here if we get on black ice  Ray sticks her head out the window but the snow and the wind are too strong. She stops.
I can't believe you left it out there.
Slow down, I don't want to run over it.
I don't want to touch it.
He's got no reason to stop us, unless you give him one, so keep your mouth shut.
He won't, just remember you're white.
That was the Great Spirit, not me.
I got glasses and now I can see up close.
You got a run for us, Jimmy?
We need to get paid, first.
You only got six hundred here.
Let's get out of here. I'll give you the rest of the money.
You're gonna get us all killed.
You should'a just taken the money from me?
We gotta get outta here, first.
Slow down a little. We gotta keep it under the speed limit.
We gotta get off this road.
We gotta get off this road!
Just up at the tree line.
They can't arrest us but if they catch us they'll take the money.
That ice is black out here.
We gotta crawl out the window.
Sorry, Thunder, I got nothing for you.
I shouldn't even be dealing with you.
Bernie was askin' if I'd seen you. I told him no.
I don't want any trouble with him, Lila.
This guy's been calling all morning. He's got two up at the Old Casino.
It's pretty slow after Christmas. Unless you wanna to go off the Rez, there's a guy up in Montreal who's usually got heads.
Twenty miles or so. But...you gotta watch out for the Mounties and the Surete.
We just need to borrow your oven, Mom.
Come on, Billy, you never bothered with smugglers before.
How's life at the Bingo Palace.
No, but he said not to sell you a car.
For you, all I got are two Chevettes,a Horizon and a Civic.
I don't want Bernie in my face. Okay?
D'ey don't like de women driver.
D'is will keep d'em from running.
You get the rest at drop off.
That's the deal I make with Jimmy, now you want to change?
You want to make a problem?
...because you're not making a problem for me. And you're making a problem for them. Let me show you something.
You must be the brains of the operation.
You aren't so smart as you look.
We only take cash or money orders.
Chance! Chance, get in here before you freeze your ass off.
Temps will dip tonight and tomorrow.
Hey, I just got done here. I made two hours overtime fixing one of the snow-
Ray, are you gonna pick up or not?
Lila. Get up. I got a job for you!
They got two people out sick today, so if you get down there you got the job.
Get dressed, I got coffee. Let's go!
Get in, I'll tell you on the way.
The Tribal Council needs someone to answer phones.
Why not? You can answer a phone, can't you?
What do you need a car for?
You'll live. And you know what I'm talking about.
We got our own court system.
If we did, we'd have to arrest half the people on the Rez.
You can't start throwin' Mohawks off the Rez, Rosalie. There's only, what, six thousand of us as it is.
But she has a Mohawk son.
We've had smuggling on the Rez since Al Capone.
You're in a lot of trouble.
The council voted to expel you.
For five years. You can appeal, but you'll never be able to change Rosalie's mind.
They'll make your life miserable if you try to stay.
Believe me, it could get even worse.
If she leaves, they'll turn you in Lila.
The Chiefs want her out, so there's nothing standing between her and the troopers.
If you leave she won't see her son again.
Lila, you're giving up on him and he's only one year old.
He wanted to keep you and little Jake safe.
She's gonna kill me for taking this out of her car.
You got a problem with your machine, lady!
No, I can't read any of it.
Do you know where they are?
We don't charge people with smuggling.
She makes the Mohawk people look bad.
She cost us a Mohawk son.
She'll never be anything but a smuggler.
She had something in the bag.
She says her baby. Her baby was in the bag.
Thanks Man, Have a Merry One.
Could you step out of the vehicle, ma'am.
Just step out of the car.
Ma'am I'm just directing you to step out of the vehicle?
Step around to the back of the vehicle.
Your left rear parking light is not illuminated.
I'm gonna give you a provisional citation. Get this repaired in the next 48 hours and you'll have no problem.
Is there a Ray Eddy here?
Can I speak to you outside for a minute.
It's not about that. I just have a few questions.
This is about the woman who was with you.
How long have you known her?
Yes, well, there is that element on the Reservation I'm sure you know.
How did you happen to meet her?
I just thought you should be aware of that. She's known to have smuggled illegal immigrants into the country.
If I were you I'd find a new baby sitter.
Well, you have an enjoyable Holiday.
As long as they're not on a watch list.
I don't think you have much to worry about judging from the look of them, probably brought here to work in the sex trade.
Not necessarily. They can apply for asylum.
Is there somebody I can call for you? To take care of your children.
...the Quebec Surete in pursuit of a vehicle with New York State plates, identified as a blue Plymouth Acclaim and the suspects are two women, suspected to be carrying illegals...
Jimmy, I told you not to bring no more half frozen people in here off the river.
I don't see how I can get any baking done. I'm supposed to be baking 200 doughnuts for pee wee Lacrosse and now I have people bleeding and dripping all over my kitchen.
Sit down, I can't reach up that high.
Looks like somebody tried to blow your brains out.
Velma motions to the Chinese girls to take off their coats. They stare at her shivering.
Somebody's been beatin' up on you.
-Good, good Mike. What can I do for you? -
We have a situation with a couple smugglers. They got chased by the Quebec police and crossed the river but their car went in and now the troopers know they're on the Rez.
Lila Littlewolf and some white woman.
A surrender of the two illegals and the Non-Native smuggler. They need an example here.

Rosalie is worried people are gonna think the Mohawks let in terrorists. Plus, I got the Troopers on my back. They want the illegals and they say there's some white lady with them too. Is that true, Jimmy?
You got white women doing it now? Jesus.
Well, if you see any, let me know.
